items.title: Hate laws to pass after Labor and Liberal deal
items.description: The Liberal Party struck an agreement with Labor to tighten the scope of a bill to ban hate groups, but the position of the Nationals is unclear.

items.title: Live: Nationals abstain as hate laws pass lower house of parliament
items.description: National MPs have abstained from voting on the federal government's hate speech bill, which has passed the lower house of parliament. Follow live.

items.title: Surfer bitten by shark at NSW beach in fourth attack in 48 hours
items.description: The 39-year-old man was surfing at Point Plomer, near Crescent Head, this morning when the shark bit through his board.

items.title: Origin extends life of Australia's largest coal-fired power station
items.description: The operator of Australia's largest coal-fired power station is to extend the life of its plant in the NSW Hunter Valley for another two years.

items.title: British-born Aussies giving up UK citizenship over new passport rules
items.description: Frustrated dual British-Australian citizens are weighing up their options in response to new passport rules. Here's why some are letting go of their British citizenship.

items.title: What is Trump's Board of Peace and why could it be threat to the UN?
items.description: Donald Trump appears to be trying to build his own international peacekeeping body, which he calls the "Board of Peace". Here's why experts think it might attempt to rival the UN.

items.title: Trump goes to Davos as bond market vigilantes plot against him
items.description: There are signs Donald Trump's bold strategy to artificially lower interest rates could backfire, as a level of disquiet emerges on money markets, particularly in bonds.

items.title: ABC appoints Isabella Higgins as new host of AM program
items.description: The former Europe correspondent succeeds Sabra Lane, who has announced she will step down after nine years of presenting.

items.title: Police say 'dingoes had physically been in contact' with dead woman
items.description: The woman was found surrounded by dingoes after going for an early-morning swim.

items.title: Women's football captain departs club over offensive 'Silly Saturday' costumes
items.description: A women's senior football captain has stepped away from her local club after photos of the senior men's leadership team were posted online during their "Silly Saturday" post-season celebrations.

items.title: Live: 'Incredible' Ukrainian all smiles after giving defending champ almighty fright
items.description: Madison Keys wins through after being shocked early on Rod Laver Arena, while Australians Maya Joint and Taylah Preston make it a mixed morning for the local hopes. Follow live.

items.title: Two die as car and train collide at level crossing west of Geelong
items.description: The crash between the car and a freight train happened at a level crossing near the small town of Cressy at about 10am on Tuesday.

items.title: Six charged after alleged NYE hooning and social media posts
items.description: Police allege several vehicles blocked northbound lanes of Brisbane's Gateway Motorway at Murarrie before a group performed burnouts and let off fireworks just before midnight.

items.title: Man taken to hospital after crocodile attack in north Qld
items.description: It is understood the man in his 20s suffered puncture wounds to his lower back, upper legs and hand.

items.title: 12yo girl and two others dead after fiery late-night ute crash, sister in hospital
items.description: A Kingaroy mother and daughter have died in a head-on ute crash in the South Burnett, as well as the driver of the other vehicle. A 13-year-old girl is in hospital in a stable condition.

items.title: New footage of thieves in Louvre heist released by French media
items.description: The security footage shows the thieves smashing the glass on the display cases where the jewellery was kept.

items.title: Live: BHP sets iron ore production record, IMF calls out Australia's 'drawn-out' inflation
items.description: The ASX trades flat on Tuesday. The International Monetary Fund says Australia, alongside Norway, is projected to see persistent above-target inflation. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: Families of Wieambilla officers call for gun reform as Qld rejects national scheme
items.description: Judy McCrow says the families "fully support" the federal government's proposed gun buyback scheme and are calling on political parties to stop "bickering".

items.title: Aspiring paramedic Sienna completes HSC a year after brain cancer diagnosis
items.description: Just over a year ago Sienna was shocked to discover she had a rare brain cancer. She's taking a new drug to slow its growth, but it's come at great cost.

items.title: First Nations woman asked about eating ants takes department to court
items.description: A First Nations employee at South Australia's Department for Infrastructure and Transport (DIT) has claimed she was sexually harassed by her supervisor and racially discriminated against when asked about eating ants before a cultural training session, court documents reveal.

items.title: Man charged with murder one year after 'random' bushland attack
items.description: Police have charged a 29-year-old man after the alleged murder of a 60-year-old man, who was found with serious head injuries on a fire trail in Nowra in December 2024.

items.title: Emergency services under pressure as suspicious fires triple in WA's South West
items.description: A growing number of suspicious fires left police and firefighters under significant pressure over the Christmas period.

items.title: Tasmanian child with knife wounds flown to Melbourne, woman charged
items.description: Police are investigating after a child presented to the Launceston General Hospital with serious injuries.

items.title: Brisbane hit by vaccine shortages after wall collapses at warehouse
items.description: Brisbane parents are being turned away from GP clinics due to a shortage of childhood vaccines.

items.title: Groundwater drying up as blistering Pilbara heatwave continues
items.description: Water sources are depleting in the Pilbara as the arid region endures a summer with little rainfall and temperatures close to 50C.
